intro: Coccoloba lapathifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf coccoloba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that are often bright green and have a smooth texture. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Coccoloba lapathifolia is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various soil types.
